definition: from house to house, one by one
in order/in sequence/close to/adjacent to
to suffer/to endure/to pull through (hard times)/to delay/to stall/to play for time/to dawdle

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]
to go from house to house
see 挨家挨戶|挨家挨户[ai1 jia1 ai1 hu4]

sentences.english: The farmer peddled his fruit from house to house.
sentences.chinese: 那個農民挨家挨戶兜售他的水果。

sentences.english: He's a door-to-door salesman. Sixty-three years old.
sentences.chinese: 他是個挨家挨戶上門推銷的推銷員，今年63歲。

sentences.english: She helped clear ditches and even went door to door offering well-cleaning for free.
sentences.chinese: 她幫助清理溝渠，甚至挨家挨戶免費爲大家清理水井。

sentences.english: But the man came along, reading the numbers on the houses.
sentences.chinese: 那人一路騎過來，挨家看着門牌號碼。

sentences.english: A sergeant went from door to door requisitioning bullets for the men.
sentences.chinese: 一名中士挨家挨戶地給戰士們徵集彈藥。

sentences.english: Bankers start by counting notes and sales managers start with door-to-door selling.
sentences.chinese: 銀內行先要數鈔票，發賣司理先要挨家挨戶地傾銷。

sentences.english: Guyana doesn’t have enough health workers to carry the tablets door to door.
sentences.chinese: 圭亞那沒有足夠的衛生人員挨家挨戶地區派發藥片。

sentences.english: The children were formed into small groups, which went from door to door collecting money and old colthes.
sentences.chinese: 孩子們分成幾個小組，挨家挨戶地募款和舊衣服。

sentences.english: Jon, a ninth-grader, knocked on doors in his neighborhood.
sentences.chinese: 九年級學生喬恩在他的鄰近地區挨家挨戶敲門。

sentences.english: I sold encyclopedias door to door, almost 50 years ago.
sentences.chinese: 差不多50年前，我挨家挨戶推銷百科全書。

sentences.english: He used to go door-to-door and sell soda pop.
sentences.chinese: 那時他常常挨家挨戶地推銷蘇打汽水。

sentences.english: A back door to door collection of waste batteries.
sentences.chinese: 一組回挨家挨戶收廢舊電池。

sentences.english: The house-to-house surveillance for cases is continuing.
sentences.chinese: 正在繼續進行挨家挨戶的病例監測。

sentences.english: Door-to-door water-sellers are still a common sight in poor areas.
sentences.chinese: 在貧困地區，人們常常可以看到挨家挨戶賣水的人。

sentences.english: The grant helped pay for hiring local vaccinators to go house to house.
sentences.chinese: 這筆獎助金用來聘請當地人挨家挨戶進行免疫工作。

sentences.english: The Prince and his footman went from house to house of all the ladies invited to the ball.
sentences.chinese: 霍文的王子和他挨家挨戶的夫人的邀請所有的球。

definition: to go from house to house
from house to house, one by one
see 挨家挨戶|挨家挨户[ai1 jia1 ai1 hu4]
from door to door, one by one
erhua variant of 挨個|挨个[ai1 ge4]
neighbors/next-door neighbors/related work units/colleagues doing related work
see 串門|串门[chuan4 men2]
to call on sb/to drop in/to visit sb's home
to visit relatives
to inquire about/to give sb the third degree
to go onto the streets/to go shopping
neighbors/the whole neighborhood
erhua variant of 串門|串门[chuan4 men2]
to go to market/to go to a fair
village/hamlet
to drop in/to visit/to lock a door/(of a shop) to close/to go and live with one's wife's family, in effect becoming a member of her family
